Hyperloop Names Denver Route a Winner, Announces CDOT Partnership

Galvanize is a dynamic learning community for technology that provides web development and data science education, workspace for startups, freelancers, and enterprise companies, as well as networking opportunities that increase access between talent and industry. My role as Evangelist is to increase brand awareness, foster influencer relationships, and generate student and membership leads in Denver as well as engage relevant companies, events, workshops, programming, and conferences. In this dynamic role, I have the opportunity to:  -Lead, build, and foster communities and relationships to achieve revenue growth-Strategically create and leverage relationships to support business development-Host and teach introductory lessons in web development-Create and maintain mutually beneficial brand partnerships-Facilitate and plan large scale enterprise events-Create strategic experiments to drive brand engagement, feedback, and adoption-Track, analyze, and improve conversions from event leads-Pitch Galvanize at meetups, conferences, and events-Collaborate cross functionality with almost every team in the company -Co-organize 3 Meetups: Learn to Code Colorado, Colorado Data Science, and freeCodeCamp  I co-organize 3 Meetups: Learn to Code Colorado, Colorado Data Science, and freeCodeCamp Denver.

-Built and grew a community around the brand-Scaled incredible brand experience for over 100,000 users-Conceptualized, created, and managed the ‘Rafflecopter Influencer’ Community-Sold software to a wide range of businesses and stakeholders-Conceptualized and executed customer retention campaigns-Deployed VoC reports that translated to tangible product improvement-Worked closely with users at all points during customer lifecycle-Produced content, resources, and documentation to ensure success of users-Wrote engaging blog and website content

-Created a successful business from the ground up-Successfully produced images for the NFL, MLS, and for multiple 100,000+ person events-Pursued constant and constructive feedback for successful business growth -Set challenging yet achievable goals-Established a mind-set of constant self improvement

I had the pleasure of working directly with Josh for 3 years while at Rafflecopter. Josh was a swiss army knife, originally hired to help our team with product support, but quickly progressed his duties to content creation, product management, and sales. Really anything he could get his hands on.All of Josh’s duties were pivotal into supporting our growing community surrounding our product, used by hundreds of thousands of people. He helped manage the onboarding process of potential customers, which included a mix of customer outreach, customer development, and community management.Josh was able to adapt quickly to the fast-paced work environment that you’ll find at a software startup like Rafflecopter. That’s why we hired him, and that’s why he had so many different roles at our company. At a company with less than 10 people, it’s easy as a manager to see who is putting in the extra hours, and Josh was always going above and beyond in his duties. Josh is very well organized, diligent, and was a very loyal employee and supporter at our company. His attitude was infectious and if given the opportunity again, I'd work with him in a heartbeat.

September 6, 2017, Josh reported directly to Greg

I had the opportunity to work under Greg for 3 years. He’s not only an incredible founder but also brings an immense amount of expertise in product development and business development to the table as well. Being an incredible strategic thinker and product manager, he led the charge in shaping the Rafflecopter product and scaling it from 0 to over 100,000 users in just a few years. I was able to observe and learn from his skillset working with developers, designers, and external partners. Additionally, having a natural knack for managing diverse skillsets, he enabled the marketing and support employees at Rafflecopter to thrive in their roles as well enabling his team to work efficiently and scale quickly. Greg is not only an incredible business leader and marketer, he’s a genuinely a great person and gifted mentor as well.

Kris was absolutely incredible to work with. In addition to being a brilliant designer, Kris is an amazing individual who is truly gifted in her craft. I was able to work with Kris on multiple projects at Galvanize. She was always clear, kind, and compassionate in how she carried herself and interacted with others. You can immediately tell the amount of passion and creativity she brings to the table. She had to manage more design needs for the company than I could ever imagine. She successfully did so with an amazing level of organization and attention to detail. She’s sharp, creative, and warm-hearted. I truly hope I have the opportunity to work with her again.
